title.raw: 《李斯列傳》 Biography of Li Si

sentences.zh: 李斯者，楚上蔡人也。

translations.literal: Li Si was a man of Shangcai in Chu.

sentences.zh: 年少時，為郡小吏，見吏舍廁中鼠食不絜，近人犬，數驚恐之。

translations.literal: When young, he served as a minor official in the commandery, saw that rats in the office latrine ate unclean things, being near people and dogs, were frequently startled and frightened by them.

sentences.zh: 斯入倉，觀倉中鼠，食積粟，居大廡之下，不見人犬之憂。

translations.literal: Li Si entered the granary, observed that the rats there ate stored grain, dwelt beneath the great eaves, did not see worries about people and dogs.

sentences.zh: 於是李斯乃嘆曰：「人之賢不肖譬如鼠矣，在所自處耳！」

translations.literal: Thereupon Li Si sighed and said: 'People's worthiness or unworthiness is like rats - it depends on where they place themselves!'

Li Si was a person from Shangcai in Chu. Young time, was county petty official, saw official residence toilet rat eat unclean things, near people dogs, repeatedly frightened by them. Si entered granary, observed granary rats, eat stored grain, dwell great house below, not see people dogs worry. Thus Li Si then sighed: 'Person's worthy unworthy like rats, in where self-place!'

sentences.zh: 乃從荀卿學帝王之術。

translations.literal: Then he studied the arts of rulership under Xun Qing.

sentences.zh: 學已成，度楚王不足事，而六國皆弱，無可為建功者，欲西入秦。

translations.literal: Studies already complete, he assessed that the King of Chu was not worth serving, and the six states were all weak, with none offering opportunity to establish merit, desired to go west to enter Qin.

sentences.zh: 辭於荀卿曰：「斯聞得時無怠，今萬乘方爭時，游者主事。

translations.literal: He took leave of Xun Qing, saying: 'I have heard that when opportunity comes, one must not delay. Now is the time when ten-thousand chariot states are contending, and itinerant persuaders hold the reins of affairs.'

sentences.zh: 今秦王欲吞天下，稱帝而治，此布衣馳騖之時而游說者之秋也。

translations.literal: Now the King of Qin wishes to swallow the world, establish himself as emperor and govern - this is the time for commoners to gallop forward and the season for persuaders to roam.

sentences.zh: 處卑賤之位而計不為者，此禽鹿視肉，人面而能閒行者耳。

translations.literal: Those who remain in lowly positions and do not plot action are like birds and deer that see meat but wear human faces while being able to stroll idly.

sentences.zh: 故詬莫大於卑賤，而悲莫甚於窮困。

translations.literal: Therefore, no disgrace is greater than lowly status, and no sorrow is deeper than poverty and hardship.

sentences.zh: 久處卑賤之位，困苦之地，非世而惡利，自託於無為，此非士之情也。

translations.literal: To long dwell in lowly positions and places of hardship, to reject the world and despise profit, to entrust oneself to inaction - this is not the nature of a gentleman.

sentences.zh: 故斯將西說秦王矣。」

translations.literal: Therefore, I will go west to persuade the King of Qin.'

Thus followed Xun Qing study emperor king methods. Study already complete, measured Chu king not sufficient serve, six states all weak, no can establish merit, wished west enter Qin. Took leave Xun Qing: 'Si heard get time no lazy, now ten thousand chariot contending time, travelers master affairs. Now Qin king wishes swallow world, call emperor govern, this common clothes gallop time wandering persuaders autumn. Dwell low base position plan not do, this bird deer see meat, person face can leisurely walk. Thus curse none greater low base, sorrow none more poor distress. Long dwell low base position, poor distress place, not world evil profit, self-entrust no action, this not scholar sentiment. Thus Si will west persuade Qin king.'

sentences.zh: 至秦，會莊襄王卒，李斯乃求為秦相文信侯呂不韋舍人；

translations.literal: Arriving in Qin, he encountered the death of King Zhuangxiang, so Li Si sought to become a retainer of Lü Buwei, Chancellor of Qin and Marquis Wenxin;

sentences.zh: 不韋賢之，任以為郎。

translations.literal: Lü Buwei valued him, appointed him as a gentleman-attendant.

sentences.zh: 李斯因以得說，說秦王曰：「胥人者，去其幾也。

translations.literal: Li Si thus gained opportunity to speak, spoke to the King of Qin, saying: 'As for ferrymen, they remove the oars.'

sentences.zh: 成大功者，在因瑕釁而遂忍之。

translations.literal: Those who achieve great deeds do so by exploiting weaknesses and seeing ruthlessness through to completion.

sentences.zh: 昔者秦穆公之霸，終不東并六國者，何也？

translations.literal: In former times, when Duke Mu of Qin achieved hegemony, why did he ultimately not annex the six eastern states to the east?

sentences.zh: 諸侯尚眾，周德未衰，故五伯迭興，更尊周室。

translations.literal: The feudal lords were still numerous, the Zhou virtue had not yet declined, therefore the Five Hegemons rose in succession, taking turns to honor the Zhou house.

sentences.zh: 自秦孝公以來，周室卑微，諸侯相兼，關東為六國，秦之乘勝役諸侯，蓋六世矣。

translations.literal: Since Duke Xiao of Qin, the Zhou house has been humble, the feudal lords have annexed each other, east of the passes they became six states, Qin has been victorious over and made the feudal lords serve it, for six generations now.

sentences.zh: 今諸侯服秦，譬若郡縣。

translations.literal: Now the feudal lords submit to Qin, like prefectures and counties.

sentences.zh: 夫以秦之彊，大王之賢，由灶上騷除，足以滅諸侯，成帝業，為天下一統，此萬世之一時也。

translations.literal: With Qin's strength and Your Majesty's wisdom, sweeping away the feudal lords would be as easy as brushing dust from a stove, sufficient to destroy the feudal lords, complete the imperial enterprise, unify the world under one rule—this is a once-in-ten-thousand-generations opportunity.

sentences.zh: 今怠而不急就，諸侯復彊，相聚約從，雖有黃帝之賢，不能并也。」

translations.literal: Now if we delay and do not quickly seize it, the feudal lords will grow strong again, gather together in alliances, even with the wisdom of the Yellow Emperor, we cannot annex them.'

sentences.zh: 秦王乃拜斯為長史，聽其計，陰遣謀士齎持金玉以游說諸侯。

translations.literal: The King of Qin then appointed Li Si as Chief Clerk, listened to his plans, secretly dispatched counselors bearing gold and jade to persuade the feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 諸侯名士可下以財者，厚遺結之；

translations.literal: For the famous scholars of the feudal lords who could be brought down with wealth, he richly gifted them and bound them to Qin;

sentences.zh: 不肯者，利劍刺之。

translations.literal: Those who refused, he had assassinated with sharp swords.

sentences.zh: 離其君臣之計，秦王乃使其良將隨其後。

translations.literal: After sowing discord in their ruler-minister relationships, the King of Qin sent his good generals to follow up.

sentences.zh: 秦王拜斯為客卿。

translations.literal: The King of Qin appointed Li Si as Guest Minister.

Reached Qin, met Zhuangxiang Wang died, Li Si then sought be Qin chancellor Wenxin Hou Lü Buwei retainer; Buwei considered worthy, employed as lang. Li Si thus got persuade, persuaded Qin king: 'Wait person, remove their sprouts. Complete great merit, in take advantage flaws continue bear. Former Qin Mu Gong hegemony, end not east unite six states, why? Feudal lords still many, Zhou virtue not decline, thus five hegemons alternated rise, more honored Zhou room. Self Qin Xiao Gong since, Zhou room low small, feudal lords mutually annexed, pass east six states, Qin take victory serve feudal lords, cover six generations. Now feudal lords submit Qin, like prefecture county. With Qin strong, great king worthy, by stove sweep away, sufficient extinguish feudal lords, complete emperor enterprise, make world unite, this ten thousand generations one time. Now lazy not urgently pursue, feudal lords again strong, mutually gather alliance, though have Yellow Emperor worthiness, cannot unite.' Qin king then appointed Si long shi, listened his plan, secretly sent strategists carry hold gold jade wandering persuade feudal lords. Feudal lords famous scholars can lower with wealth, thick gifts bind them; Not willing, sharp sword stab them. Separate their lord minister plans, Qin king then made his good generals follow after. Qin king appointed Si guest minister.

sentences.zh: 會韓人鄭國來閒秦，以作注溉渠，已而覺。

translations.literal: It happened that Zheng Guo from Han came to sow discord in Qin by proposing to build an irrigation canal, but afterward this was discovered.

sentences.zh: 秦宗室大臣皆言秦王曰：「諸侯人來事秦者，大抵為其主游閒於秦耳，請一切逐客。」

translations.literal: All the Qin nobles and ministers spoke to the King of Qin: 'People from the feudal states who come to serve Qin generally do so as spies for their lords in Qin, we request to expel all such guests.'

sentences.zh: 李斯議亦在逐中。

translations.literal: Li Si's name was also included among those to be expelled.

sentences.zh: 斯乃上書曰：

translations.literal: Li Si then submitted a memorial saying:

Met Han person Zheng Guo come spy Qin, to make irrigation canal, afterward aware. Qin clan chamber ministers all spoke Qin king: 'Feudal lords people come serve Qin, generally for their lord wandering spy Qin, please all expel guests.' Li Si discussion also in expel among. Si then submitted letter:

sentences.zh: 臣聞吏議逐客，竊以為過矣。

translations.literal: I have heard that the officials are discussing expelling the guests, and I privately consider it a mistake.

sentences.zh: 昔繆公求士，西取由余於戎，東得百里奚於宛，迎蹇叔於宋，來丕豹、公孫支於晉。

translations.literal: In former times, Duke Mu sought worthy men, taking You Yu from the Rong in the west, obtaining Baili Xi from Wan in the east, welcoming Jian Shu from Song, bringing Pi Bao and Gongsun Zhi from Jin.

sentences.zh: 此五子者，不產於秦，而繆公用之，并國二十，遂霸西戎。

translations.literal: These five men were not produced in Qin, but Duke Mu employed them, annexed twenty states, and achieved hegemony over the Western Rong.

sentences.zh: 孝公用商鞅之法，移風易俗，民以殷盛，國以富彊，百姓樂用，諸侯親服，獲楚、魏之師，舉地千里，至今治彊。

translations.literal: Duke Xiao employed Shang Yang's laws, transformed customs and mores, the people became prosperous and numerous, the state wealthy and strong, the common people gladly served, the feudal lords submitted willingly, defeated the armies of Chu and Wei, gained a thousand li of territory, and to this day remains orderly and strong.

sentences.zh: 惠王用張儀之計，拔三川之地，西并巴、蜀，北收上郡，南取漢中，包九夷，制鄢、郢，東據成皋之險，割膏腴之壤，遂散六國之從，使之西面事秦，功施到今。

translations.literal: King Hui employed Zhang Yi's strategies, seized the lands of the Three Rivers, annexed Ba and Shu to the west, took Shangjun to the north, seized Hanzhong to the south, encompassed the Nine Yi tribes, controlled Yan and Ying, occupied the strategic pass at Chenggao to the east, carved out fertile lands, thereby breaking up the alliances of the six states, making them face west and serve Qin, benefits extending to the present day.

sentences.zh: 昭王得范睢，廢穰侯，逐華陽，彊公室，杜私門，蠶食諸侯，使秦成帝業。

translations.literal: King Zhao obtained Fan Sui, deposed the Marquis of Rang, expelled the Lord of Huayang, strengthened the royal court, blocked private influence, gradually encroached on the feudal lords, enabling Qin to complete the imperial enterprise.

sentences.zh: 此四君者，皆以客之功。

translations.literal: These four rulers all achieved success through guests.

sentences.zh: 由此觀之，客何負於秦哉！

translations.literal: From this perspective, what harm have guests done to Qin?

sentences.zh: 向使四君卻客而不內，疏士而不用，是使國無富利之實而秦無彊大之名也。

translations.literal: If those four rulers had rejected guests and not admitted them, distanced themselves from worthy men and not employed them, this would have left the state without substantial wealth and prosperity, and Qin without its reputation for strength and greatness.

Minister heard officials discuss expel guests, secretly considered wrong. Former Mu Gong sought scholars, west took You Yu from Rong, east got Baili Xi from Wan, welcomed Jian Shu from Song, came Pi Bao, Gongsun Zhi from Jin. These five persons, not born in Qin, yet Mu Gong used them, united twenty states, thus hegemoned west Rong. Xiao Gong used Shang Yang methods, moved customs changed habits, people with flourishing prosperous, state with rich strong, hundred surnames happy use, feudal lords intimate submit, obtained Chu, Wei armies, took land thousand li, to now govern strong. Hui Wang used Zhang Yi plan, pulled three streams land, west united Ba, Shu, north took Shang commandery, south took Han middle, included nine Yi, controlled Yan, Ying, east occupied Cheng Gao dangers, cut fertile rich soil, thus scattered six states alliance, made them west face serve Qin, merit extended to now. Zhao Wang got Fan Sui, abolished Rang Hou, expelled Hua Yang, strengthened public chamber, blocked private gates, nibbled feudal lords, made Qin complete emperor enterprise. These four lords, all with guests merit. From this see, guests what owe Qin! If made four lords reject guests not admit, distant scholars not use, this made state no rich profit substance yet Qin no strong great name.

sentences.zh: 今陛下致昆山之玉，有隨、和之寶，垂明月之珠，服太阿之劍，乘纖離之馬，建翠鳳之旗，樹靈鼉之鼓。

translations.literal: Now Your Majesty has obtained jade from Mount Kun, possesses the treasures of Sui and He, hangs moon-bright pearls, wears the Tai'e sword, rides the Xianli horses, flies banners with kingfisher-feathered phoenixes, sets up drums with spirit-alligator skins.

sentences.zh: 此數寶者，秦不生一焉，而陛下說之，何也？

translations.literal: None of these several treasures are produced in Qin, yet Your Majesty delights in them. Why is that?

sentences.zh: 必秦國之所生然後可，則是夜光之璧不飾朝廷，犀象之器不為玩好，鄭、衛之女不充後宮，而駿良駃騠不實外廄，江南金錫不為用，西蜀丹青不為采。

translations.literal: If it must be that only what is produced in Qin is acceptable, then luminous jade would not adorn the court, rhinoceros and ivory vessels would not be made into luxuries, women from Zheng and Wei would not fill the rear palace, fine horses like the Julu would not fill the outer stables, gold and tin from south of the Jiang would not be used, cinnabar and azurite from Western Shu would not be gathered.

sentences.zh: 所以飾後宮充下陳娛心意說耳目者，必出於秦然後可，則是宛珠之簪，傅璣之珥，阿縞之衣，錦繡之飾不進於前，而隨俗雅化佳冶窈窕趙女不立於側也。

translations.literal: If it must be that only what comes from Qin is acceptable for adorning the rear palace, filling the lower ranks, delighting the heart, and pleasing the eyes, then pearl hairpins from Wan, jade earrings from Fu, gossamer robes from A, embroidered decorations would not be presented at court, and the elegant, refined, beautiful, slender women of Zhao who follow customs would not stand at the side.

sentences.zh: 夫擊甕叩缶彈箏搏髀，而歌呼嗚嗚快耳（目）者，真秦之聲也；

translations.literal: Striking jars, tapping pots, plucking zithers, slapping thighs, and singing with calls of 'wu wu' to delight the ears—these are truly Qin's sounds;

sentences.zh: 鄭、衛、桑閒、昭、虞、武、象者，異國之樂也。

translations.literal: Zheng, Wei, Sangjian, Zhao, Yu, Wu, Xiang—these are the musics of different states.

sentences.zh: 今棄擊甕叩缶而就鄭衛，退彈箏而取昭虞，若是者何也？

translations.literal: Now abandoning striking jars and tapping pots to approach Zheng and Wei, retreating from plucking zithers to take Zhao and Yu—why is this?

sentences.zh: 快意當前，適觀而已矣。

translations.literal: It is simply that pleasure is before one, and one takes what is suitable for viewing.

sentences.zh: 今取人則不然。

translations.literal: Now in taking people, it is not like this.

sentences.zh: 不問可否，不論曲直，非秦者去，為客者逐。

translations.literal: Without asking whether suitable or not, without discussing right or wrong, if not Qin-born, they go, if guests, they are expelled.

sentences.zh: 然則是所重者在乎色樂珠玉，而所輕者在乎人民也。

translations.literal: Thus what is valued is beauty, music, pearls, and jade, while what is slighted is the people.

sentences.zh: 此非所以跨海內制諸侯之術也。

translations.literal: This is not the way to stride across the realm and control the feudal lords.

Now Your Majesty brings Kun mountain jade, has Sui, He treasures, hangs bright moon pearls, wears Tai E sword, rides slender li horses, establishes kingfisher phoenix flags, sets spirit crocodile drums. These several treasures, Qin not produce one, yet Your Majesty delights them, why? Must Qin state produced then can, then night light jade not adorn court, rhinoceros elephant vessels not for playthings, Zheng, Wei girls not fill rear palace, swift good dun horses not fill outer stables, Jiangnan gold tin not for use, west Shu cinnabar blue not for gather. What adorn rear palace fill lower ranks please heart intent delight ears eyes, must from Qin then can, then Wan pearl hairpins, Fu jewel earrings, A plain clothes, brocade embroidery ornaments not advance front, follow customs refined transformation fine beautiful secluded lovely Zhao girls not stand side. Beat jars strike pots pluck zheng slap thighs, sing call wu wu please ears eyes, true Qin sounds; Zheng, Wei, Sang Jian, Zhao, Yu, Wu, Xiang, different states music. Now abandon beat jars strike pots approach Zheng Wei, retreat pluck zheng take Zhao Yu, like this why? Pleasure before, suitable view already. Now take people then not so. Not ask can cannot, not discuss curved straight, not Qin leave, guest expel. Then this what valued in color music pearl jade, what light in people. This not what stride within control feudal lords method.

sentences.zh: 臣聞地廣者粟多，國大者人眾，兵彊則士勇。

translations.literal: I have heard that broad lands have abundant grain, large states have numerous people, strong armies have brave soldiers.

sentences.zh: 是以太山不讓土壤，故能成其大；

translations.literal: Therefore Mount Tai does not reject soil, thus it can achieve its greatness;

sentences.zh: 河海不擇細流，故能就其深；

translations.literal: Rivers and seas do not choose small streams, thus they can achieve their depth;

sentences.zh: 王者不卻眾庶，故能明其德。

translations.literal: True kings do not reject the multitudes, thus they can manifest their virtue.

sentences.zh: 是以地無四方，民無異國，四時充美，鬼神降福，此五帝、三王之所以無敵也。

translations.literal: Therefore lands have no four directions (boundaries), people have no foreign countries, the four seasons are abundantly beautiful, spirits and gods send down blessings—this is why the Five Emperors and Three Kings were invincible.

sentences.zh: 今乃棄黔首以資敵國，卻賓客以業諸侯，使天下之士退而不敢西向，裹足不入秦，此所謂「藉寇兵而齎盜糧」者也。

translations.literal: Now instead you abandon the black-headed people to enrich enemy states, reject guests to strengthen the feudal lords, causing the scholars of the world to retreat and not dare to face west, to wrap their feet and not enter Qin—this is what is called 'lending weapons to bandits and giving provisions to robbers.'

Minister heard land broad grain many, state great person many, troops strong then scholars brave. Thus Tai mountain not reject soil, thus can complete its great; River sea not choose fine streams, thus can reach its deep; Kings not reject masses, thus can clarify their virtue. Thus land no four directions, people no different states, four seasons full beautiful, ghosts gods descend fortune, this five emperors, three kings why no enemy. Now abandon black heads to aid enemy states, reject guests to enrich feudal lords, make world scholars retreat not dare west face, wrap feet not enter Qin, this called 'borrow bandit troops give robber grain'.

sentences.zh: 夫物不產於秦，可寶者多；

translations.literal: Things not produced in Qin that can be treasured are many;

sentences.zh: 士不產於秦，而願忠者眾。

translations.literal: Scholars not produced in Qin, but those willing to be loyal are numerous.

sentences.zh: 今逐客以資敵國，損民以益讎，內自虛而外樹怨於諸侯，求國無危，不可得也。

translations.literal: Now expelling guests enriches enemy states, harming the people to benefit enemies, internally weakening ourselves while externally creating resentment among the feudal lords—seeking safety for the state, it cannot be obtained.

Things not produce in Qin, can treasure many; Scholars not produce in Qin, wish loyal many. Now expel guests to aid enemy states, harm people to benefit enemies, inner self empty outer plant resentment in feudal lords, seek state no danger, cannot obtain.

sentences.zh: 秦王乃除逐客之令，復李斯官，卒用其計謀。

translations.literal: The King of Qin then abolished the order to expel guests, restored Li Si's office, and in the end adopted his strategies.

sentences.zh: 官至廷尉。

translations.literal: He rose in office to become Superintendent of Trials.

sentences.zh: 二十餘年，竟并天下，尊主為皇帝，以斯為丞相。

translations.literal: After more than twenty years, he ultimately unified the world, honored his lord as emperor, and made Li Si chancellor.

sentences.zh: 夷郡縣城，銷其兵刃，示不復用。

translations.literal: He razed the city walls of the commanderies and counties, melted down their weapons, showing they would not be used again.

sentences.zh: 使秦無尺土之封，不立子弟為王，功臣為諸侯者，使後無戰攻之患。

translations.literal: He caused Qin to have no inch of enfeoffed land, not establishing sons and younger brothers as kings, nor meritorious ministers as feudal lords, so that later there would be no troubles of warfare and attack.

Qin king then abolished expel guests order, restored Li Si office, finally used his plans. Office to court wei. Twenty plus years, finally united world, honored lord as emperor, with Si as chancellor. Leveled commandery county cities, melted their weapons, showed not use again. Made Qin no chi soil fiefs, not establish sons brothers as kings, merit ministers as feudal lords, made later no war attack worries.

sentences.zh: 始皇三十四年，置酒咸陽宮，博士仆射周青臣等頌始皇威德。

translations.literal: In the thirty-fourth year of the First Emperor, he held a banquet in the Xianyang Palace, and the Doctor Assistant Commander Zhou Qingchen and others praised the First Emperor's might and virtue.

sentences.zh: 齊人淳于越進諫曰：「臣聞之，殷周之王千餘歲，封子弟功臣自為支輔。

translations.literal: The man from Qi, Chunyu Yue, advanced to remonstrate, saying: 'I have heard that the kings of Yin and Zhou lasted more than a thousand years by enfeoffing sons, younger brothers, and meritorious ministers as their supporting pillars.'

sentences.zh: 今陛下有海內，而子弟為匹夫，卒有田常、六卿之患，臣無輔弼，何以相救哉？

translations.literal: Now Your Majesty possesses the entire realm, yet your sons and younger brothers are commoners. If suddenly there should be troubles like those of Tian Chang and the Six Ministers, I have no supporting pillars—how would I save the situation?

sentences.zh: 事不師古而能長久者，非所聞也。

translations.literal: Affairs that do not take antiquity as teacher and yet can endure long—such things I have not heard of.

sentences.zh: 今青臣等又面諛以重陛下過，非忠臣也。」

translations.literal: Now Zhou Qingchen and the others flatter you to your face to compound Your Majesty's errors—they are not loyal ministers.'

sentences.zh: 始皇下其議丞相。

translations.literal: The First Emperor sent this debate down to the chancellor.

sentences.zh: 丞相謬其說，絀其辭，乃上書曰：「古者天下散亂，莫能相一，是以諸侯并作，語皆道古以害今，飾虛言以亂實，人善其所私學，以非上所建立。

translations.literal: The chancellor considered his words mistaken and his arguments flawed, then submitted a memorial saying: 'In ancient times the world was scattered and chaotic, none could unify it, therefore the feudal lords arose together. Their words all cited antiquity to harm the present, embellished empty talk to confound reality, people praised their private studies to criticize what the ruler had established.'

sentences.zh: 今陛下并有天下，別白黑而定一尊；

translations.literal: Now Your Majesty has unified the world, distinguished black from white and established singular authority;

sentences.zh: 而私學乃相與非法教之制，聞令下，即各以其私學議之，入則心非，出則巷議，非主以為名，異趣以為高，率群下以造謗。

translations.literal: Yet private scholars mutually criticize the laws and teachings, and when they hear orders issued, each uses their private studies to debate them. sentences.zh: 笔吾願賜志廣欲，長享天下而無害，為之柰何？」

sentences.zh: 夫賢主者，必且能全道而行督責之術者也。

translations.literal: As for worthy rulers, they must be able to preserve the Way and practice the techniques of supervision and accountability.

sentences.zh: 督責之，則臣不敢不竭能以徇其主矣。

translations.literal: When supervised and held accountable, ministers dare not fail to exhaust their abilities in service to their lord.

sentences.zh: 此臣主之分定，上下之義明，則天下賢不肖莫敢不盡力竭任以徇其君矣。

translations.literal: When the divisions between minister and lord are fixed, and the righteousness of superior and inferior is clear, then all the worthy and unworthy in the world dare not fail to exhaust their strength and fulfill their duties in service to their ruler.

sentences.zh: 是故主獨制於天下而無所制也。

translations.literal: Therefore the lord alone controls the world and is controlled by nothing.

sentences.zh: 能窮樂之極矣，賢明之主也，可不察焉！

translations.literal: He can exhaust the extremes of pleasure. He is a worthy and enlightened ruler—how can this not be examined!

Worthy lord, must moreover can complete way execute supervise responsibility method. Supervise responsibility them, then ministers dare not not exhaust ability to follow their lord. This minister lord division decided, above below righteousness clear, then world worthy unworthy none dare not exhaust strength exhaust duty to follow their ruler. Thus lord alone controls world without controlled. Can exhaust pleasure extreme, worthy enlightened lord, can not examine!

sentences.zh: 故《申子》曰「有天下而不恣睢，命之曰以天下為桎梏」者，無他焉，不能督責，而顧以其身勞於天下之民，若堯、禹然，故謂之「桎梏」也。

translations.literal: Therefore Master Shen said 'To possess the world without indulging in pleasures is called making the world one's fetters'—there is no other reason than this: one cannot supervise and hold accountable, but instead personally labors for the people of the world, like Yao and Yu, therefore it is called 'fetters.'

sentences.zh: 夫不能修申、韓之明術，行督責之道，專以天下自適也，而徒務苦形勞神，以身徇百姓，則是黔首之役，非畜天下者也，何足貴哉！

translations.literal: If one cannot cultivate the enlightened techniques of Shen and Han, practice the way of supervision and accountability, but exclusively uses the world to suit oneself, while merely striving to torment the body and exhaust the spirit, serving the common people with one's person, then this is the servant of the black-headed people, not the possessor of the world—what is there to value in this!

sentences.zh: 夫以人徇己，則己貴而人賤；

translations.literal: When people serve oneself, then oneself is noble and people are base;

sentences.zh: 以己徇人，則己賤而人貴。

translations.literal: when one serves people, then oneself is base and people are noble.

sentences.zh: 故徇人者賤，而人所徇者貴，自古及今，未有不然者也。

translations.literal: Therefore those who serve others are base, while those served by others are noble—from ancient times to the present, there has never been otherwise.

sentences.zh: 凡古之所為尊賢者，為其貴也；

translations.literal: All the ways of antiquity honored the worthy because they were noble;

sentences.zh: 而所為惡不肖者，為其賤也。

translations.literal: while what was done to condemn the unworthy was because they were base.
